ai-tha-ap531:0.3_0: he gave the gift of the Queen Paṇḍas and the Elder Nunnery
ai-tha-ap531:1.4_0: Worlding up and down on the path,
ai-tha-ap531:2.2_0: I was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-tha-ap531:2.4_0: walking mindfully in the shade of the Great Wood.
ai-tha-ap531:3.2_0: Having raised my joined palms to him,
ai-tha-ap531:3.4_0: I drunk the fruit of my garden.
ai-tha-ap531:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap531:4.4_0: this is the fruit for the living.
ai-tha-ap531:6.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap531:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Paṇḍarāsa.
ai-tha-ap531:9.1_0: for the chapter on sticks and fruits,
